Overview:

We are a leading property insurer of the world's largest businesses providing more than one-third of FORTUNE 1000-size companies with engineering-based risk management and property insurance solutions. FM Global helps clients maintain continuity in their business operations by drawing upon state-of-the-art loss-prevention engineering and research; risk management skills and support services; tailored risk transfer capabilities; and superior financial strength. To do so, we rely on a dynamic, culturally diverse group of employees, working in more than 100 countries, in a variety of challenging roles.

 

FM Global has several rewarding and exciting full-time, 6-month, paid co-op opportunities to offer to students that are motivated to apply their classroom experience, professional demeanor, and personal ambition. You will get firsthand experience while earning college credits and getting paid!

 

FM Globals co-op opportunities are based at our corporate headquarters in Johnston, RI, which is part of the greater Providence area. With a large college-age population, Providence offers a vibrant arts and entertainment scene that includes local theatre and music, collegiate and minor league sporting events, great restaurants. position: Local College Co-op - Emergency Services & Security
description:
Dow has an exciting part-time cooperative education job opportunity available in Midland, MI. This position is open to qualified and highly-committed college students enrolled in a fully accredited college or university located very close to the Midland Dow site. Unlike a short-term internship project outside of school terms, this particular role is a long-term, year-round, undergraduate student position -- at least one full year in duration -- while the student is simultaneously taking classes toward an undergraduate degree. This opportunity offers the student valuable professional work experience in a dynamic, multi-national corporation interfacing with colleagues and leaders in many different roles. This program is designed for academically successful students who meet ALL of the specific job and co-op program requirements listed below and who can simultaneously succeed both in school and in a professional work environment.

   

Job Purpose

This position of a Student Security Officer within the Emergency Services & Security (ES&S) department exists to provide security and process the flow of personnel and materials at the gate locations of the Midland area corporate, manufacturing and research locations.

Key Job Responsibilities

Key responsibilities include, but not limited to:

  • Performing vehicle inspections

  • Effective, professional and helpful communication and conduct with employees, customers, suppliers, etc.

  • Enforcement of security procedures

  • Documentation for visitors and materials in and out of Dow facilities

  • Monitoring/operation security and access control systems, security alarms, badge programming/creation, camera operations, and tracking system for shipping of dry and bulk materials.

Required & Preferred Qualifications

  • Must be pursuing an undergrad degree from a fully accredited college or university near the Dow Midland, MI site.

  • A major in criminal justice or fire science is preferred but not required. 

  • During vehicle inspections, the student must be able to climb in and out of vehicles, including semi-trucks.

  • Depending on the shift that is available, there is a potential to work a shift other than a day shift.

  • The student will periodically need to operate a vehicle during their assignment; therefore, a valid driver's license and safe driving is required.

  • During winter months, salting and shoveling the sidewalks are also required.

  • Candidates must have good interpersonal skills.

  • Candidates must be able to multitask during emergency and normal operational situations and have the ability to change priorities as needed.

  • Teamwork and cooperation are essential, as well as taking independent initiative on things that need to be done.

  • Candidates must be knowledgeable with computers and Microsoft applications, especially using Word, Excel and Outlook.

Critical Requirements of the Local Student Co-Op Program

  • High school diploma/GED and already enrolled at an accredited college or university located close to the Midland Dow site, pursuing an undergraduate degree.

  • Successfully complete a minimum of 6 credit hours per term during both the Fall and Winter terms (~Sept-Apr).

  • Seeking high performing student with strong GPAs of 3.000+; however, a minimum 2.700+ term and cumulative GPA on a 4.000 scale is required at ALL times – both to enter and to continue working in the Dow co-op program.  Attach a screen capture from your school’s website or a copy of your most recent transcripts/grade report showing classes and recent GPAs to this application.  Eligibility to continue in this cooperative education program is checked every term.

  • Able to begin work very soon, usually within 3 weeks of the job offer, and work year-round at least 20 hours each week ONLY during our regular business hours (8am-5pm, Mon-Fri…max 8 hours/day and 30/week during school).

  • Commit to the role for at least 1 full calendar year (BEFORE completing classes for your stated undergraduate degree or BEFORE transferring out of the area).  Students available longer than one year before completing their degree program are preferred and advantaged. 

  • Reliable attendance and punctuality in commuting to work daily or at least 3 days a week; therefore, dependable transportation, dedication and time management skills are absolutely required. 

  • Registered/enrolled in their school's Cooperative Education Program before the first day at Dow and comply with the school’s policies/requirements, in addition to Dow's, for the duration of co-op employment. 

  • Any current Dow college co-ops wishing to transfer into this role must have been in their current role at least one full year, must have at least one full year left before graduating or transferring out of the area, and must have supervisor approval before applying to each Dow co-op job posting.

Candidates who receive a job offer will be required to pass a background check and drug screen/medical evaluation and will verify school-related requirements and I-9 documentation before being hired into Dow.

A minimum requirement for this U.S. based position is the ability to work legally in the United States.  No visa sponsorship/support is available for this position, including for any type of U.S. permanent residency (green card) process.

About Dow

 

Dow (NYSE: DOW) combines global breadth, asset integration and scale, focused innovation and leading business positions to achieve profitable growth. The Company’s ambition is to become the most innovative, customer centric, inclusive and sustainable materials science company, with a purpose to deliver a sustainable future for the world through our materials science expertise and collaboration with our partners. Dow’s portfolio of plastics, industrial intermediates, coatings and silicones businesses delivers a broad range of differentiated science-based products and solutions for its customers in high-growth market segments, such as packaging, infrastructure, mobility and consumer care. Dow operates 106 manufacturing sites in 31 countries and employs approximately 35,700 people. Dow delivered sales of approximately $39 billion in 2020. References to Dow or the Company mean Dow Inc. and its subsidiaries. For more information, please visit www.dow.com or follow @DowNewsroom on Twitter.

position: Staff Engineer, Process Technology Development R&D
description:
Job Location: Hershey, PA
 


 


Summary:  
The Staff Engineer uses process engineering and food science principles to lead process development research projects and programs.  One key focus area of current research will be leadership of chocolate process development research related to better for you initiatives and sugar reduction, from benchtop to pilot scale, and commercialization supporting both ingredient development and finished product.  Additionally, he/she will lead program technical strategy development, project design and methodology, test ideas through experimentation, and determine next steps through problem solving.  The successful candidate will be leading projects of higher complexity and apply technical rigor to ensure project goals and business objectives are achieved.  He/she will need to be able to prioritize his/her work and contribute to strategic directions within R&D.  He/she will progress technical research, by disciplined application of the scientific method through the project management process and the transfer of knowledge to Product Development, Commercialization and/or Operations teams. Hands-on skills involving running laboratory and pilot plant equipment is required.  In addition to working with R&D team members, the staff engineer is expected to be able to work along side our cross-functional partners in Marketing, Product Development, Sensory, Manufacturing, Legal, Engineering, Quality and other Supply Chain  departments as well as our M&A partners. The successful candidate will report to the group’s Principal Engineer. 


 


Summary of major duties:



  • Actively seek new technologies and innovation opportunities. 

  • Lead chocolate process technology development worksteams for both ingredient development and finished products from bench top to pilot to commercial scale which may focus on BFY chocolate process development.

  • Lead complex process development and process validation to support product commercialization in various areas for the Hershey Company.

  • Test ideas through experimental design, collect and analyze data using analytical process tools to provide recommendations.

  • Determine next steps through problem solving. 

  • Collaborate with cross-functional groups to ideate, identify, develop solutions, and commercialize new technologies. 

  • Have a good understanding of current processing technologies across snacks and confectionery industry and continue to explore new and breakthrough technologies.

  • Mentor and guide junior scientists and engineers within R&D. 

  • Provide leadership and instruction to technicians. 

  • Ability to connect and interact with peers from other within and other industries  to exchange information and ideas in area of expertise where appropriate.


 


Process development; lab & pilot-plant equipment operation



  • Operate or direct the operation of lab or pilot-plant equipment in the

  • performance of  tests or experiments. Lead the development of new 

  • processes through research and experimentation to deliver project results.

  • Hands-on work involving running lab, pilot plant and factory equipment.   



Research design/data analysis/report writing/ presentation  



  • Design and execute experiments, analyze data and provide conclusions using an appropriate statistical tool. Prepare all project reports as required.  Make presentations of significant results to drive business decisions.



Minimum knowledge, skills and abilities required to successfully perform major duties/responsibilities:  
•    Experience leading a cross-functional team in a development of new process and/or technologies. 
•    Sound technical knowledge and capability of applying knowledge to research projects. 
•    Understanding of the fundamentals of chocolate including formulations, manufacturing, forming, and downstream processes. 
•    Understanding of the impact of the key processing parameters in the conversion of raw ingredient and in-process material to finished product. 
•    Demonstrated excellence in project leadership and decision making ability.
•    Comfortable with operating pilot plant and/or lab equipment. 
•    Excellent written and verbal communication skills. 
•    Demonstrated mathematical and statistical skills. 
•    Possesses computer skills (basic knowledge of Word, Access, Excel, Exchange)
•    Ability to work in a team environment and independently in a flexible work environment with changing priorities. 



Minimum Education and Experience Requirements: 
Education: BS degree in Chemical Engineering, Food Engineering, Food Science, Chemistry, or related field required.
Experience: 5-10+ years (B.S. food/engineering degree) or 3-5+ years (M.S.) in R&D environment  in process development, process validation, food engineering.  Intern and prior research project work will be considered. 
Experience in chocolate processing is a plus.

position: Staff Scientist, Ingredient Technology Development R&D
description:
Job Location: Hershey, PA
 


 


 


Summary:  
The Staff Scientist uses food science principles to lead ingredient technology development research projects and programs.  One key focus area of current research will be program leadership of chocolate, sweets, and/or snacks ingredient technology development research related to better for you initiatives and sugar reduction, from benchtop to pilot scale, and commercialization supporting both ingredient development and finished product.  Additionally, he/she will lead program technical strategy development, project design and methodology, test ideas through experimentation, and determine next steps through problem solving.  The successful candidate will be leading projects and programs of higher complexity and apply technical rigor to ensure project goals and business objectives are achieved.  He/she will need to be able to prioritize his/her work and contribute to strategic directions within R&D.  He/she will progress technical research, by disciplined application of the scientific method through the project management process and the transfer of knowledge to Product Development, Commercialization and/or Operations teams. Hands-on skills involving running laboratory and pilot plant equipment is required.  In addition to working with R&D team members, the staff scientist is expected to be able to work along side our cross-functional partners in Marketing, Product Development, Sensory, Manufacturing, Legal, Engineering, Quality and other Supply Chain  departments as well as our M&A partners.  This staff scientist will also need to demonstrate excellent organizational and communication skills as he/she develops technical strategies and shares proposals and updates with cross functional teams and leadership across our organization.



Major Duties/Responsibilities:  
Project and Program Leadership for Technology Development        
-Actively seek new technologies and innovation opportunities. 
-Lead chocolate technology development worksteams for both ingredient development and finished products from bench top to pilot to commercial scale which may focus on BFY goals.
-Test ideas through experimental design, collect and analyze data using analytical process tools to provide recommendations.
-Determine next steps through problem solving. 
-Collaborate with cross-functional groups to ideate, identify, develop solutions, and commercialize new technologies. 
-Have a good understanding of current ingredient technologies across snacks and confectionery industry and continue to explore new and breakthrough opportunities.
-Mentor and guide junior scientists and engineers within R&D. 
-Provide leadership and instruction to technicians. 
-Ability to connect and interact with peers from other within and other industries  to exchange information and ideas in area of expertise where appropriate.


Ingredient Technology Development; lab & pilot-plant equipment operation
Operate or direct the operation of lab and/or pilot-plant equipment in the
performance of  tests or experiments. Lead the development of new 
ideas through research and experimentation to deliver project results.
Hands-on work involving running lab, and pilot plant product manufacturing and characterization equipment. 
Research design/data analysis/report writing/ presentation  
Design and execute experiments, analyze data and provide conclusions using an appropriate statistical tool. Prepare all project reports as required. Make presentations of significant results to drive business decisions.



Minimum knowledge, skills and abilities required to successfully perform major duties/responsibilities:  
•Experience leading a cross-functional team in a development of new ingredient technologies. 
•Sound technical knowledge and capability of applying knowledge to research projects. 
•Understanding of the fundamentals of chocolate including formulations, manufacturing, forming, and downstream processes. 
•Understanding of the impact of the key processing parameters in the conversion of raw ingredient and in-process material to finished product. 
•Demonstrated excellence in project leadership and decision making ability.
•Comfortable with operating pilot plant and/or lab equipment. 
•Excellent written and verbal communication skills. 
•Demonstrated mathematical and statistical skills. 
•Possesses computer skills (basic knowledge of Word, Access, Excel, Exchange)
•Ability to work in a team environment and independently in a flexible work environment with changing priorities. 



Minimum Education and Experience Requirements:  
Education:BS in Food Science, Food or Chemical Engineering, Chemistry, or related field required. MS preferred but not required. 
Experience:10+ years (B.S. food science / food engineering) or 7+ years (M.S.) in R&D environment, or 4+years (PhD) in R&D environment. Product development experience strongly preferred. Confectionery experience in chocolate, sweets and/or snacks is strongly preferred.  Intern and prior research project work will be considered.

Job Location: Hershey, PA   


 


Summary:


 


Reporting to the Director of Ingredient Technology Development and Futures R&D, the Sr. Research Scientist will be responsible for ingredient technology development and research related to the Better-For-You initiative and Sugar reduction from benchtop to pilot plant to commercialization. The role of this position will be more highly focused on bringing new ingredient technologies to life in product applications across our snacking portfolio, including chocolate, sweets, and snacks.


 


In addition to working with R&D team members, considerable interaction is expected with Marketing, Product Development, Sensory, Manufacturing, Legal, Engineering, Quality, and other Supply Chain departments. The Senior Research Scientist will manage relationships internally and externally with business partners, suppliers, research institutes, universities, and other service providers to deliver required research results. The Senior Research Scientist assumes a leadership role in complex projects and guides them through Hershey Innovation process with a cross-functional team. He or she will participate in project design and methodology, test ideas through experimentation, and determine next steps through problem solving.


 


This individual will take the initiative to secure, from all available sources, pertinent advice, ideas, and information having a bearing upon the project. Hands-on skills involving running laboratory and pilot plant equipment is required. Experience in leading a cross-functional technology and/or product development project to commercialization is desired. Presentation of the project results will be expected in both written and oral forms.


 


Responsibilities:


 


Project Leadership for Technology Development - Lead (60%) Assist (5%) Supervise (5%)



  • Actively seek new technologies and innovation opportunities

  • Lead ingredient technology development workstreams for both ingredient development and finished products from bench top to pilot to commercial scale which will focus heavily on BFY initiatives.

  • Champion assigned projects through Hershey Innovation process by owning process specifications that deliver quality product at commercialization

  • Test ideas through experimental design, collect and analyze data using analytical process tools to provide recommendations

  • Bring technical rigor to troubleshoot technical issues

  • Determine next steps through problem solving

  • Collaborate with cross-functional groups to ideate, identify, develop solutions, and commercialize new technologies

  • Have a good understanding of current ingredient and processing technologies across snacks and confectionery industry and continue to explore new and breakthrough technologies

  • Mentor and guide junior scientists and engineers within R&D

  • Provide leadership and instruction to technicians


 


Product and Process development and characterization; lab & pilot-plant equipment operation



  • Operate or direct the operation of lab or pilot-plant equipment in the performance of tests or experiments. Lead the development of new processes through research and experimentation to deliver project results. Hands-on work involving running lab, pilot plant and factory equipment. Characterize products and ingredients, and/or develop new methods as needed to characterize these matrices.  


 


Research design/data analysis/report writing/ presentation 



  • Design and execute experiments, analyze data, and provide conclusions using an appropriate statistical tool. Prepare all project reports as required. Create and deliver presentations of significant results to drive business decisions.


 


Minimum knowledge, skills and abilities required to successfully perform major duties/responsibilities:


 



  • Sound technical knowledge capable of applying knowledge to research project

  • Excellent communication, written and critical thinking skills

  • Lead process development, operating pilot plant and/or lab equipment

  • Strong project management and organizational skills

  • Demonstrated success in leading multiple and simultaneous projects.

  • Possess good computer skills (basic knowledge of Word, Access, Excel, Exchange)

  • Ability to work in a team environment and independently in a flexible work environment with changing priorities

  • Strong mathematical skills

  • Experience in leading a cross-functional research and/or product development project.


 


Minimum Education and Experience Requirements: 


 



  • B.S. degree in Food Science, Chemical Engineering, Food Engineering, Chemistry, or related field required

  • 5-8 years’ experience (with B.S. food science, chemistry, or engineering degree) or 5+ years’ experience (with M.S.), or 2-4 years’ experience (with PhD) in R&D environment

  • Intern and prior research project work will be considered

  • Confectionary experience in chocolate, sweets, and/or snacks is preferred

  • Product development, and/or technology development experience is preferred

Desired
•Bachelor's degree in Computer Science (STEM discipline preferred). •Experience developing business process flows and soliciting business requirements •Knowledge of testing methodologies and/or project management •Familiarity with Enterprise Resource Management or Customer Relationship Management software •Certifications in technical specialties such as Microsoft, Cisco, etc. •Prior experience supporting a Windows environment •Familiarity with Linux and Windows, and networking concepts such as IP networks •Knowledge of Sarbanes Oxley controls •Experience troubleshooting network communications issues with vendors and carriers

description:
Company Description

Stratas Foods LLC is the leading supplier of fats and oils to the Foodservice, Food Ingredients and Retail Private Label markets in North America and is a producer of quality bulk and packaged dressings, mayonnaise and sauces. Stratas Foods was formed in October 2008 as a 50/50 joint venture between ACH Food Companies (ACH) and Archer Daniels Midland (ADM).

Manufacturing facilities are located in Dallas and Houston, TX; Decatur and Quincy, IL; Englewood, NJ; Fresno, CA; Nashville, TN; and Valdosta, GA.  Corporate offices are located in Memphis, TN.  We are committed to maintaining a progressive workplace by utilizing the ideas, skills and talents of all of our employees.  We strive to make Stratas Foods a great place to work and are building a team capable of meeting our business goals.

Job Description

The Stratas Finance Team has an exciting opportunity for a talented Information Computer Science intern to help build small scale applications.   As an intern with Stratas Foods, you will not only work with and learn from industry professionals, but you will also share in the culture of teamwork at Stratas Foods.  

As an intern, key responsibilities will include the following:

  1. Conduct needs analysis
  2. Build small scale applications for the finance department based on business needs
  3. Work with the IT Department and Master Data Governance Team
Qualifications

  • An individual who has at least 1-2 years of undergraduate studies remaining
  • A concentration in Information Technology or related field
  • Application development background through any of the RAD (Rapid Application Development) softwares
  • Strong communication skills
  • A highly motivated self-starter
  • Strong organizational skills
  • Strong analytical skills
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, specifically Excel and Macros
  • Proficient in SQL – Nice to have
  • Proficient in PowerBI – Nice to have
  • Critical Thinker


Additional Information

Competencies:

Communications – Strong negotiation and interpersonal skills in dealing with those both internal and external to Stratas are critical to success

Leadership - Ability to lead others in the directions necessary to achieve mutually beneficial goals is important

Analytical Skills – Having both the ability and competency to evaluate a variety of alternatives and pick the best solution in a dynamic work environment

Root cause problem-solving techniques:  Critical to a line manufacturing process

Developing teamwork and productivity:  Being proactive in employee relations efforts serves all well

Stratas Foods is an equal opportunity employer and will not discriminate against any applicant or employee in any manner prohibited by law, including but not limited to, on the basis of race or color, religion, gender, age, genetic information, national origin/ancestry, mental or physical disability, family status/marital status, sexual orientation, military/veteran status, and any other legally protected status.

Tired of web companies masquerading as tech startups? Looking for real development, with real impact

We are a pioneering autonomous building systems startup company. We are building a groundbreaking autonomous control platform for high-performance buildings and the future of smart cities. 

We have a position for a computer science intern that offers the opportunity to be a meaningful part of a team, develop production code, build test infrastructure, construct IT solutions, and solve real-world engineering problems.

This is an internship position (or entry-level), with the potential of a full-time position for the right candidate. Opportunity for involvement is limited only by your enthusiasm.

What you will be doing:

  • Developing a client-side application software
  • Building test infrastructure 
  • Database development for cloud and test support
  • Building machine learning back-end
  • Developing data visualization interfaces
  • IT infrastructure management 

You must have:

  • Strong research and problem solving skills
  • Experience with MacOS
  • Networking and system administration knowledge and experience
  • Strong programming skills (e.g. Javascript, Swift, Typescript, etc)
  • Must be able to both work in a team and have the ability to self manage on your own

You should have:

  • Experience with relational databases, PostgreSQL
  • Experience with repositories, and content management
  • Experience with HTML and CSS
  • Experience with MVC design patterns

It's helpful to have:

  • Fundamentals of human-computer interaction design
  • Experience with application development
  • Experience with AI and ML
  • Experience with Xcode

Compensation:

  • Competitive compensation; Hourly wage, based on experience 
  • Medical, dental, vision (full time
  • Free drinks, snacks, and catered lunches
  • We can support academic credits for students
  • Must be diligent and get work done, but we do respect powder days

To apply for this position:

You must have or near completing a B.S. or better. Unless you have significant experience, a coding bootcamp isn't sufficient computer science background for this position. With your introduction and resume, include a description of a project (of any type) you personally created, devised, built, managed, organized, or designed that was of your own self-initiative. Also include any portfolio work, links to your code repo, personal website, etc.

About PassiveLogic

PassiveLogic builds the world's first autonomous platform for buildings. We make an infinitely configurable platform that enables users to design their own custom autonomous systems. We've reinvented the fundamental principals of automation to replace todays antiquated control logic.Our focus is democratizing automation for the average person, have an unmatched impact of energy savings, while ensuring buildings and smart cities are accessible, self-optimizing and human-centric.

  • Designs, develops, documents, and tests software solutions in accordance with project specifications, ensuring completion within the planned time constraint and meeting the established objectives for quality, reliability and performance. Uses judgment in suggesting adaptations or modifications where appropriate.

Qualifications

 

What we look for

  • Ability to manipulate large data collections in both databases and spreadsheets.

  • Action-Oriented: You thrive as a self-starter who proactively senses and responds to problems and opportunities.

  • Collaborative: You love teamwork. Your colleagues love having you on the team. You have a sense of humor and are comfortable collaborating across sales, product, account management, engineering and marketing to deliver results.
  • Detail-Focused: You can manage multiple projects simultaneously, in a matrixed organization, with attention to detail, tenacity, and a focus on results.
  • Analytical: Proven analytical skills and the ability to effectively organize marketing data.

Responsibilities

Job Description

WHATS IN IT FOR YOU

Our purpose is to lead the way to tomorrows energy network. Your work as an intern can impact millions of people who depend on electricity for their everyday lives.

You will get "real world" experience to begin or further your career pursuits in the energy industry. This is a paid intern position for 10 -12 weeks during summer 2021.
You get to work on interesting and challenging assignments that will help grow your skill set.
You will work in an extremely collaborative environment inside our LEED certified Folsom, California campus.
Opportunities to interact with the CEO and the Executive team of the ISO
Invitations to seminars on the latest energy industry topics such as renewables, electric cars and micro grids.
Potential field trips.
Social activities with other interns such as barbecues and movie nights.
You get to work on our "green" LEED certified Folsom, California campus with some of the brightest people in the industry.

WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING

Past Assignments have included work such as:

Building new software tools in support of the reliable operation of the Grid and the energy markets we facilitate. You will learn more about smart grid technology, renewable resources, forecasting and the latest developments in energy industry. You will see ow the work you do this summer contributes directly to the success of the California Grid
Data validation and user acceptance testing (UAT), schedule and monitor processes necessary for calculation and publication of energy market settlement statements and invoices.
Development of enterprise-wide systems integration mapping, with database that links to interface specification. Interface with IT Architects, UML Modelers, and QA Leads to understand how to best depict these system-to-system interfaces to meet specific use cases.
Provide technical content and sample code for the ISOs developer.caiso.com website.
Document archiving solutions for new technologies as well as development of automation solutions.
Oracle Database/Storage task queue maintenance, documentation, create automation scripts for Oracle database admin tasks/storage procurement and document, create automated reports of daily DBA/Storage procedures, create standard monitoring scripts, generate capacity reports.
Projects to develop work products that will reduce processing time, enhance transparency or enhance capabilities in departments across the organization.

Qualifications

Qualifications

LEVEL OF EDUCATION AND DISCIPLINE

Currently in a Bachelors degree (BS) or Masters degree (MS) program in Computer Science, MIS or related field.
Graduating December of 2021 or later.

AMOUNT OF EXPERIENCE

Previous internships, research or work experience using economic analysis is desired.
Research and or studies in energy industry highly desired.

TYPE OF EXPERIENCE

Proficient in Microsoft office suite.
Good presentation, oral and written communication skills highly desirable.
Must be able to work effectively in a team environment.
Excellent analytical and problems solving skills required.

ADDITIONAL SKILLS AND ABILITIES

Strong quantitative skills.
Competence in software such as R, Python, SQL, and Java desired but not required.

Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Company Description

Wish is a mobile e-commerce platform that flips traditional shopping on its head. We connect hundreds of millions of people with the widest selection of delightful, surprising, and—most importantly—affordable products delivered directly to their doors. Each day on Wish, millions of customers in more than 160 countries around the world discover new products. For our over 1 million merchant partners, anyone with a good idea and a mobile phone can instantly tap into a global market. 

We're fueled by creating unique products and experiences that give people access to a new type of commerce, where all are welcome. If you’ve been searching for a supportive environment to chase your curiosity and use data to investigate the questions that matter most to you, this is the place.

Job Description

On the Data team at Wish, we are using data to build one of the fastest growing and largest eCommerce startups today, with over 300 million users. We're doing this from the ground up, and building our own merchant platform, logistics network, customer service software, and content management tools. We're a small team and move quickly. This is a full-time or part-time internship (3-5 days/week) for 6 months, starting immediately.

What you'll be doing:

  • Applying your quantitative, data mining, and presentation skills in helping the business to understand growth drivers and identify opportunities for optimization
  • Defining and validating metrics to evaluate business performance
  • This role will have exposure in various parts of the business such as merchant growth, logistics, customer service, and content.
  • We work with Python, SQL, Hive, Apache Airflow, Git
Qualifications

  • Solid foundation in computer science, math and/or software engineering
  • Strong competencies in data structures, algorithms and software design
  • Interest in end-to-end feature development from design to execution
  • Self-motivated, hands-on, relentlessly focused on impact, and able to operate under a great deal of independence
  • Strong knowledge of statistics
  • Familiar with SQL
  • Clear communicator
  • Experience from at least 1 previous internship in Data Science or Analytics


Additional Information

Wish values diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive work environment. We provide equal employment opportunity for all applicants and employees. We do not discriminate based on any legally-protected class or characteristic. Employment decisions are made based on qualifications, merit, and business needs. If you need assistance or accommodation due to a disability, please let your recruiter know. Enthusiast Auto Holdings (EAH) is one of the largest specialty e-commerce companies in the automotive aftermarket industry.

partners with hundreds of other performance brands to bring the enthusiast community a diverse range of automotive products.

and for providing a highly professional support experience to our teams and our growing staff. This intern position is open at our

ECS Tuning banner located in Wadsworth, OH.

Active Directory, Microsoft Endpoint Manager (Intune), Google Workspace, and network components common to large business

environments. Qualified candidates will be able to gain advanced technical knowledge, adapt and implement industry best

practices, possess strong verbal and written communication skills, possess strong problem solving skills, and have the ability to

thrive in a fast-paced team environment.

  • Serve as the first point of contact for customers seeking technical assistance
  • Respond to emails from employees seeking help with software and hardware issues
  • Work cross-functionally with stakeholders to ensure business technology needs are met
  • Maintain and troubleshoot enterprise network infrastructure components

  • Monitor systems for optimum performance and availability
  • Provide on-call system support and assistance to key personnel
  • Manage users and devices using Azure AD, Microsoft Endpoint Manager and Google
  • Workspace
  • Manage user service accounts on a variety of cloud platforms
  • (JIRA/Confluence/Slack/etc..)
  • Manage GoToConnect (Jive) cloud telephony users and devices
  • Manage and troubleshoot Windows Server services and VMware components
  • Help maintain a strong security posture throughout the enterprise
  • Aid the development team in conceptualizing updates and upgrades that will enhance
  • user experience
  • Deploy and maintain Windows, Mac, and iOS/Android endpoints
  • Deploy and maintain enterprise software packages
  • Document systems and processes, track and document ongoing changes
  • Diligently stay up-to-date with current technologies and technical developments
  • Must be onsite
  • 40 hour workweek with occasional nights and weekends

  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Strong interpersonal skills and ability to maintain a high level of courteous customer service at all times
  • Ability to work and thrive in a fast-paced environment
  • Ability to occasionally work nights and weekends, based on business needs

Netspend/Global Payments (Fortune 500) is so excited to offer an internship opportunity for Summer 2021! This internship will be a tremendous opportunity to learn about the workings of an Enterprise Project Management Office (EPMO) through hands-on project management experience. As an intern, you will gain valuable experience working with the EPMO team utilizing solutions, tools and methodologies such as JIRA, Confluence, SDLC and Agile to manage enterprise projects of all sizes. 

This exciting opportunity will require an individual who can dive into a project manager role and has a desire to learn and deliver on key project management,  process documentation and effective project status reporting activities. The intern will assist in the management of key partner projects at Netspend and will also be exposed to business functions outside of the software group, including Product, Customer Service, Finance, and Compliance processes.

Responsibilities:

  • Assist the EPMO team on various projects that may consist of analysis, requirements gathering, test plan coordination and or general project management tasks

  • Collect and help document EPMO process and procedures

  • Assist with EPMO reports, month over month project metrics and dashboards

  • Gather best practices, templates and document process as related to Banking As A Service (BAAS) projects

  • Participate and contribute to helping Netspend integrate with Changepoint, a PPM tool.

Required:

  • Must be currently enrolled in a four year Bachelors or Masters program, preferably in Business Administration, Management, MIS, Computer Science or related field

  • Proven grade point average of 3.0 or above and are on-track to graduate within 24 months

  • Able to work 35 - 40 hours a week

  • Understanding of software development processes and agile methodologies

  • Must have a working knowledge of Google/ Microsoft Suite of applications

  • Must have excellent analytical skills, strong communication skills, the ability to learn quickly, and the willingness to work independently and in a team environment

Preferred:

  • Experience in building dashboards highlighting key metrics, statistics and trends

  • Knowledge of Agile methodologies and project management tools

What’s in it for you?:

  • You will be paired with mentors for the duration of this internship

  • A Paid Internship in an Austin, Texas based technology company!

  • An opportunity to do hands-on work in a real-world environment and deliver software solutions that benefit our customers and internal business partners 

  • Learn from multiple project managers on the EPMO team on how to manage projects, sharpen your communication & executive presentation skills, and develop testing plans and documentation 

  • Participate in the PM Guild and gain insights into project management best practices and processes from a diverse group of experienced project management professionals

  • Be a part of a multi cultural, diverse team working across multiple geographical locations

  • A supportive, professional environment where you can learn and grow 

  • An opportunity for visibility to leadership and exposure to a highly-skilled technical staff

Join a Legacy of Innovation 110 Years and Counting!


With over 100 years of scientific expertise and a presence in more than 20 countries, Daiichi Sankyo and its 15,000 employees around the world draw upon a rich legacy of innovation and a robust pipeline of promising new medicines to help people. In addition to a strong portfolio of medicines for hypertension and thrombotic disorders, under the Group’s 2025 Vision to become a “Global Pharma Innovator with a Competitive Advantage in Oncology,” Daiichi Sankyo research and development is primarily focused on bringing forth novel therapies in oncology, including immuno-oncology, with additional focus on new horizon areas, such as pain management, neurodegenerative diseases, heart and kidney diseases, and other rare diseases.


Job Summary:


Daiichi Sankyo is seeking a year round IT Intern to work for approximately 20 hours per week. The ideal candidate will be able to plan, organize and communicate well; be results-driven and have the ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects. Ability to work independently is necessary for success, along with working collaboratively with all levels of the IT team and cross-functional business leaders.


Key skills required for the assignment are the ability to generate ideas, analyze an issue, problem-solve; and demonstrate learning agility and innovate thinking.


Responsibilities:


This internship will support multiple projects in IT Risk & Security Governance. Partnering with team members, the intern will gain experience and be assigned projects that include the following:


+ Review alerts to determine impact to systems and employees and perform response tasks

+ Perform analysis of a variety of data sets to investigate potentially malicious activity

+ Review threat material to determine impact and actions

+ Work closely with IT staff to work active incidents through to closure

+ Review daily reports of phishing emails/locked accounts/potentially malicious activity


Qualifications: Successful candidates will be able to meet the qualifications below with or without a reasonable accommodation.

Qualified candidates must currently be enrolled in an accredited undergraduate program (Junior or Senior) with coursework or have a strong background in the fields of Cybersecurity, Computer Science, Information Systems (or related fields).

Autonomous Vehicle Intern

At this level employee often refers problems not covered by instructions or guides to the supervisor or senior level for help or a decision.

Ann Arbor, United States

Intern

Data Processing Unit’s (DPU’s) are the new class of programmable processor’s igniting unprecedented innovation for modern data centers by offloading and accelerating networking, storage, compute and security services. As we work to advance and implement these technologies into our future offerings, our Compiler team is growing and seeking a top-tier Compiler Engineer Intern who wants an exciting and fun role as they help lead the charge to even greater accomplishments within a world-class organization. Come join us and to be part of the team in making a difference!

We are hiring a Compiler Engineer Intern for a minimum 12-week, full-time (40 hours/week) internship for the Fall 2021 term!

What you'll be doing:

Ways to stand out from the crowd:

position: Transportation Engineering R&D Lab Assistants - INTERN
description:
Description




Job Description:

Are you interested in Autonomous Vehicles and intelligent transportation systems?



Do you want to collaborate with scientists and engineers at a world class Federal R&D center for Connected and Autonomous Vehicles?


Leidos is seeking Transportation Research and Development Engineer Lab Assistants (R&D Lab Assistants) INTERN to join our team at the Saxton Transportation and Operations Laboratory (STOL or Saxton Lab), in McLean, VA.


The STOL or Saxton Lab supports the USDOT and Federal Highway Administration (FHWA) with a range of transportation and operations research programs.


This is a hands-on opportunity to be part of a large interdisciplinary research team that advances connected and automated vehicle technologies by developing, testing, and demonstrating new capabilities associated with Vehicle-to-Vehicle and Vehicle-to-Infrastructure communications (V2V, V2I, and V2X).


http://careers.leidos.com/stol


Primary Responsibilities


The R&D Lab Assistant INTERN will participate in some or all of the following:

+ Assisting engineers and researchers with various phases of scientific research and laboratory upkeep.

+ Configuring hardware and software systems required for control of traffic signals, traffic management systems, and vehicle guidance systems.

+ Completing routine laboratory tasks as defined in Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs).

+ Contributing to the development of new best practices and SOPs for laboratory tasks.

+ Configuring electrical, scientific, or networking equipment under supervision of senior engineers.

+ Data collection and record keeping






Note: *The selected INTERN will be required to operate the vehicles and may have an opportunity for advanced driver training to serve as a Safety Driver for vehicle testing*




Basic Qualifications

+ Candidates must be enrolled in a degree program in a relevant scientific or technical discipline such as Electrical Engineering, Civil Engineering, Computer Science, Automotive Technology, etc.

+ Aptitude for technology and interest in intelligent transportation solutions.

+ Must be a good team player and able to give and take constructive feedback.

+ Must be prompt, schedule-conscious, and able to focus on the work at hand.

+ Valid driver’s license and suitability to operate a motor vehicle.

+ Your GPA needs to be included on your application and resume.




US Citizenship Requirements


Candidate must be able to obtain an Public Trust clearance.






P reference for candidates with any of the following Qualifications:

+ Linux experience.

+ Familiarity with networking technologies – routers, switches, headless computer systems.

+ Some programming/scripting experience – MATLAB, Python, JAVA, C++, or other.

+ Electromechanical troubleshooting experience

+ Direct research experience contributing to the authorship of a technical paper.

External Referral Bonus $:

Travel:No

Shift:Day
